page.title: 02SOUTH MARSTON
page.content: {South Marston}lies near the A4311 road three miles from Swindon and the Oxfordshire border. It is a small village in open countryside which is mainly pasture and arable land. The land is mostly flat and the village lies in a broad valley near the Marlborough Downs. Livestock reared are cattle, pigs and horses. There was a manor but it was demolished in 1984 for a new housing estate called The Grove. There is a Norman church and a Victorian chapel which is now derelict. We have a Country Club and a Hotel with amenities. There is also a playing field for children and a pub called the Carriers Arms for adults. There is a primary school for children aged 4 to 11 years and there are 52 children in the school and three teachers now.
